skill.name: Swarm Orchestration
skill.description: Orchestrate multi-agent swarms with agentic-flow for parallel task execution, dynamic topology, and intelligent coordination. Use when scaling beyond single agents, implementing complex workflows, or building distributed AI systems.
skill.summary: Orchestrate multi-agent swarms with agentic-flow for parallel task execution, dynamic topology, and ...
skill.author: ruvnet

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and prompt descriptions. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access. All references to commands are documentation examples for an external tool (agentic-flow). Pure prompt-based skill.

content.value_statement: Building complex AI systems with multiple agents requires sophisticated coordination. This skill provides patterns and commands for mesh, hierarchical, and adaptive swarm topologies with automatic load balancing and fault tolerance.
actual_capabilities: Initialize mesh, hierarchical, and adaptive swarm topologies
Execute tasks in parallel or sequential pipeline modes
Coordinate memory sharing across multiple agents
Enable automatic load balancing and task distribution
Configure fault tolerance with retry policies
limitations: Does not execute code directly - provides patterns for external tool
Assumes familiarity with distributed systems concepts
Cannot create agents without agentic-flow infrastructure

use_cases.title: Build Distributed AI Systems
use_cases.description: Coordinate multiple AI agents working on complex software projects with shared memory and intelligent task distribution.

use_cases.title: Automate CI/CD Pipelines
use_cases.description: Orchestrate parallel build, test, and deployment workflows with automatic retry handling and load balancing.

use_cases.title: Scale AI Experimentation
use_cases.description: Run multiple research agents simultaneously with adaptive topology that responds to task complexity.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Swarm Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use swarm orchestration to set up a mesh topology with 3 agents (coder, tester, reviewer) for parallel task execution.

prompt_templates.title: Hierarchical Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hierarchical swarm with an architect queen coordinating backend-dev, frontend-dev, and db-designer workers.

prompt_templates.title: Pipeline Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Orchestrate a pipeline: design by architect, implement by coder, test by tester, review by reviewer - each stage dependent on the previous.

prompt_templates.title: Resilient Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a swarm with exponential backoff retry (3 attempts), automatic task reassignment on failure, and dynamic load balancing based on CPU and memory metrics.

output_examples.input: Initialize a mesh swarm with coder, tester, and reviewer agents for parallel API development
output: ‚úì Fault tolerance: retry with exponential backoff
Ready to execute tasks across all agents

best_practices: Start with 2-3 agents and scale up gradually based on task complexity
Use shared memory coordination to avoid context duplication between agents
Always configure timeouts and retry policies to prevent hung tasks
anti_patterns: Starting with too many agents before understanding task requirements
Skipping memory coordination and causing context loss between agents
Ignoring performance metrics until problems become severe

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works best with Claude Code for full CLI integration.

faq.question: What swarm topologies are supported?
faq.answer: Mesh (peer-to-peer), Hierarchical (queen-worker), and Adaptive (dynamic switching based on task complexity).

faq.question: How many agents can I run?
faq.answer: No hard limit, but starts with 2-3 agents recommended. Scales based on agentic-flow configuration and system resources.

faq.question: Is my data safe with swarm coordination?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only documents patterns. Data flows through agentic-flow which stores memory locally or in configured backends.

faq.question: Why are agents not coordinating?
faq.answer: Verify memory access is enabled and hooks are active. Check that all agents can access shared memory endpoints and network connectivity.

faq.question: How does this compare to single-agent workflows?
faq.answer: Swarm orchestration handles parallel execution, better scalability, fault tolerance, and specialized agents. Best for complex, multi-part tasks.
